blog.title: Little Fish
blog.description: I'm a little fish in a big pond; but that's all right, I'm a piranha.

summary: It always surprises me when people seem to think actors only play characters similar to how they are in real life, then act all...
body:
It always surprises me when people seem to think actors only play characters similar to how they are in real life, then act all betrayed if an actor plays a horrible character.

It seems to me that one of the most fun and challenging aspects of the job would be to convincingly play someone completely different from yourself.

The actors I like tend to have reputations for being really nice people in real life, but all of them, at some point, have played characters that I want to die horribly.

The best example of this would be David Tennant as Kilgrave in Jessica Jones. I LOVE David. A lot. But I have never had a character disturb me as much as Kilgrave did. Halfway through the season, I wanted him to die. I wanted them to BURN HIM WITH FIRE AND ACID AND HURL HIS BODY INTO THE SUN. I’ve never been so skeeved out by a character that I wanted to take a shower after and just wash that filth off.

And it made me appreciate David so much more! Watching an actor I admire make me utterly hate a character takes real talent. And it hasn’t affected my admiration of him at all.

Which is why Colin’s role in ‘What Still Remains’ doesn’t bother me. It’s a role. He did it well. I had hoped his character would go in a different direction, but, oh well.

I can hate a character and still love the actor.

(This, btw, is NOT me saying you should watch this even if it triggers you; never watch something that harms you in any way! I simply mean that someone shouldn’t expect a character to reflect an actor.)

Halfway through the season, I wanted him to die. I wanted them to BURN HIM WITH FIRE AND ACID AND HURL HIS BODY INTO THE SUN. summary:
Sometimes the idea of living as a hermit appeals to all of us. No 
demands, no needs, no pain, no disappointments. But that is...

summary: why did he make kissy noises? is this his version of tutting? does he see sean as a horse or a puppy? does he see this more as...
caption: why did he make kissy noises? is this his version of tutting? does he see sean as a horse or a puppy? does he see this more as punishing a dog for doing something it shouldn’t have done? i want to know because this is killing me.
